instruction: Concern about increased appetite and potential weight gain since starting glipizide; follow-up on blood-pressure control and side-effects (ankle swelling) after switching to losartan.

attributes.comment: Appetite/weight gain on glipizide; BP and ankle swelling check on losartan

instruction: Patient recently started glipizide and reports noticeably increased hunger; home glucose readings have been lower. Patient is worried about possible weight gain. Switched from lisinopril to losartan previously; blood pressure remains controlled, cough resolved, but intermittent ankle swelling has appeared since the switch.

attributes.narrative: Recently began glipizide and notices marked increase in hunger alongside lower home glucose readings; expresses concern about potential weight gain. After prior switch from lisinopril to losartan, blood pressure remains well-controlled and cough has resolved, though intermittent ankle swelling has developed.

instruction: Type 2 diabetes mellitus without complications (ICD-10: E11.9) – blood glucose improved on glipizide; appetite increased but weight stable; continue current regimen with monitoring.

attributes.background: Blood glucose levels have improved on glipizide; appetite increased but weight remains stable, suggesting good glycemic response without adverse weight gain.
attributes.narrative: Blood glucose control has improved on current glipizide therapy; continue present regimen and monitor.

instruction: Essential (primary) hypertension (ICD-10: I10) – well controlled on losartan; intermittent ankle swelling noted; continue medication with monitoring.

attributes.background: Blood pressure remains well controlled on current losartan therapy; only intermittent ankle swelling noted.
attributes.narrative: Hypertension is well controlled on losartan. Continue current dose with ongoing monitoring of BP and ankle edema.

instruction: Patient to monitor body weight daily, remain adherent to meal plan, and report any persistent ankle swelling or significant weight gain so therapy or diet can be adjusted.

attributes.comment: Patient to monitor body weight daily, remain adherent to meal plan, and report any persistent ankle swelling or significant weight gain so therapy or diet can be adjusted.
